## What constitutes "AI"?
**Artificial Intelligence (AI)** -- *A broad body of computational methods designed to automate tasks typically associated with human intelligence, such as:*

- classification
- pattern recognition
- learning
- problem-solving

## What constitutes "AI"?
![Image from [BaslerWeb](https://www.baslerweb.com/fr-fr/learning/deep-learning/)](ai_in_research_2025-12/neuralnet.webp){fig-align="center" height="500px"}

## What constitutes "AI"?
**Some AI history...**

- 1800s -- Method of least squares for optimization
- 1950 -- Turing test a.k.a. "Imitation game"[@Turing1950]
- 1950s -- Beginnings of Machine Learning (ML) & [Artificial Neural Networks](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHQObOWTQDNU6R1_67000Dx_ZCJB-3pi&si=FhJhv3osAGNKB4i8)
- 1960s -- Beginnings of Natural Language Processing (NLP)
- 1996 -- IBM's Deep Blue defeats chess world champion Gary Kasparov
- 2020s -- Generative AI and Freemium Large Language Model (LLM) access

##  What constitutes "AI"?

##  What constitutes "AI"?
**Some takeaways...**

- AI is a very **general term** for technologies which have been in development for **"a while"**
- Recent "explosion" in AI applications is related to **(technological advances)** x **(access to technology)**
- LLMs have reduced barriers to interacting with AI models, generating both **opportunities** & **concerns** for AI use
- Our conversation today will focus on generative AI and LLMs in Research (and **see Justin's talk** on Dec. 18)

## RIBBiTR AI Poll Results

## RIBBiTR AI Poll Results

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| fig-height: 4
#| fig-width: 6

# Q1

responses = read.csv(here("presentations", "ai_in_research_2025-12", "ai_use_poll_responses.csv"))
colnames(responses) = c("timestamp",
                        "Chatbots", 
                        "Code Assistants", 
                        "Pattern Recognition", 
                        "Statistical Modeling", 
                        "Machine Learning", 
                        "Other", 
                        "q2_tools_tasks", 
                        "q3_emotions", 
                        "q4_concerns", 
                        "q5_learning")

responses_long = responses %>%
  select("Chatbots", 
         "Code Assistants", 
         "Pattern Recognition", 
         "Statistical Modeling", 
         "Machine Learning", 
         "Other") %>%
  pivot_longer(c("Chatbots", 
                 "Code Assistants", 
                 "Pattern Recognition", 
                 "Statistical Modeling", 
                 "Machine Learning", 
                 "Other"),
               names_to = "technology",
               values_to = "response") %>%
  filter(response != "")

responses_long$technology <- factor(
  responses_long$technology,
  levels = c(setdiff(unique(responses_long$technology), "Other"), "Other")
)

ggplot(responses_long, aes(x = response, fill = response)) +
  geom_bar() +
  labs(
    x = "Response",
    y = "Count",
    title = paste('"How do different AI technologies feature in your work?"')
  ) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "BrBG") +
  facet_wrap(. ~ technology) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_blank()) +
  labs(fill = "Responses") +
  xlab("")

```

## RIBBiTR AI Poll Results
"What emotions or sensations do you experience when using AI technologies?"

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| fig-height: 3
#| fig-width: 7

core_words <- responses %>%
  select(q3_emotions) %>%
  unnest_tokens(word, q3_emotions) %>%
  anti_join(stop_words) %>%
  filter(!str_detect(word, "^[0-9]+$")) %>%
  filter(str_length(word) > 2) %>%
  count(word, sort = TRUE)

set.seed(1234) # For reproducibility
wordcloud(
  words = core_words$word,
  freq = core_words$n,
  min.freq = 1,
  max.words = 50,
  random.order = FALSE,
  rot.per = 0,
  colors = brewer.pal(4, "Dark2"),
  family = "serif",
  fixed.asp = FALSE
)
```

## Liturature on AI Use in Research
![Even the smartest AI canâ€™t sign the ethics form. The figure was generated using ChatGPT.](ai_in_research_2025-12/helmy_comic.png){fig-align="center" height="400px"}

*Fig. 1 from Helmy et al., 2025 @Helmy2025-zl*

## Liturature on AI Use in Research
**Opportunities** [@Helmy2025-zl] [@Kim2024] [@Klimova2025]

- Searching & synthesizing literature
- Data wrangling & analysis
- Writing & editing (articles, reports, etc.)
- Synthesis, communication & translation

## Liturature on AI Use in Research
**Concerns** [@Helmy2025-zl] [@Kim2024] [@Klimova2025]

- Robustness (accuracy, repeatability)
- Transparency & Accountability (misrepresentation of contributions)
- Attribution (plagiarism, intellectual property, sources)
- Bias amplification
- Implications for research & communication skills
- Security & safety
- AI authorship ethics
